titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2269) to amend title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to promote the provision of retirement investment advice to workers managing their retirement income assets.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-289, by Ms. Pryce (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2269 with 1 hour and 40 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. In lieu of the amendments recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce and the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill, the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in part A of the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 96.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 288.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/14/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 2269 (promoting retirement investment advice).
